question: What is ImagesGrid?
answer: ImagesGrid is a plugin for ComfyUI that allows users to create simple grids of images with various settings.

question: What type of image grids can be created using ImagesGrid plugin?
answer: Users can create simple grids of images and XYZPlot type grids (similar to auto1111) with more settings using the ImagesGrid plugin.

question: Does ImagesGrid plugin integrate with any other tools?
answer: Yes, ImagesGrid plugin integrates with the efficiency custom node for ComfyUI.

question: Where can I find example workflows for the ImagesGrid plugin?
answer: Example workflows for the ImagesGrid plugin can be found in the workflows directory of the GitHub repository: https://github.com/LEv145/images-grid-comfy-plugin/tree/main/workflows

question: How can I install the ImagesGrid plugin for ComfyUI?
answer: To install the ImagesGrid plugin, download the latest stable release from https://github.com/LEv145/images-grid-comfy-plugin/archive/refs/heads/main.zip and unpack the node to the custom_nodes directory, for example in a folder named custom_nodes/ImagesGrid/.

question: Is the ImagesGrid plugin an open source project?
answer: Yes, the ImagesGrid plugin is an open source project and its source code can be found on GitHub at https://github.com/LEv145/images-grid-comfy-plugin.

question: Who is the author of the ImagesGrid plugin for ComfyUI?
answer: The ImagesGrid plugin for ComfyUI is developed by LEv145 on GitHub.
